speaker: Frank
text: Why is precision mattered, or why is it valued in this field?

speaker: Yoyo
text: There's a… I feel like in design, like, especially in design, they really focus on things like, like, symmetry and making it everything, like, organized, and then UI-friendly, um, because, like, there's so many websites out there, and if your website does not look, like, symmetrical, or, like, Um, it's like, everything's, like, not structured in a more, like, in an easy-to-navigate way. Like, you basically lose users, so, like, I feel like that's really important, which is, like, really different from arts, because for arts, you could be, like, super abstract and things like that, and people will still, like, look at your thing. But for design, because there's so many websites out there, if you don't make it, like, super easy to navigate immediately when you, like, pop up to their homepage, you basically lose users instantly. So I feel like that's why it's so important to make it super precise and, like, super symmetrical in terms of, like, numbers, too, and just, like, not, like, when you look at it. To, like, make sure that every user is comfortable with it, because you don't know if, like, there's users who's, like, super picky about design and just, like, just, like, looking at, like, oh, how, like, symmetrical it is.
